qas.question: What years were the miners strike?
What was the name of the miner's leader that was blamed for the strike?
Who was replaced as a leader by Foot?
When was the lorry driver's strike?
Who was blamed for the lorry driver's strike?
What did tabloid vilification of the right do?

context: Foot resigned and was replaced as leader by <a0_0><b4_0>Neil Kinnock<b4_0/><a0_0/>, with <a1_0><b5_0>Roy Hattersley<b5_0/><a1_0/> as his deputy. The new leadership progressively dropped unpopular policies. The miners strike of <a2_0><b6_0>1984–85<b6_0/><a2_0/> over coal mine closures, for which miners' leader <a3_0><b7_0>Arthur Scargill<b7_0/><a3_0/> was blamed, and the Wapping dispute led to clashes with the left of the party, and negative coverage in most of the press. Tabloid vilification of the so-called loony left continued to <b8_0>taint the parliamentary party<b8_0/> by association from the activities of 'extra-parliamentary' militants in local government.
